text: Zhang Jing (; born 18 October 1973), also known as Lina Zhang, is a Chinese short-track speed skating coach and former skater. Since 2012 she has been the head coach of the Hungarian speed skating team, which won a gold medal in Men's 5000 metre relay at the 2018 Winter Olympics over China. This was Hungary's first ever Winter Olympic gold medal. Before she was hired by the Hungarian National Skating Federation, she trained the Hungarian brothers Shaolin Sándor Liu and Shaoang Liu in her home province of Jilin with other Chinese youth skaters. ==References== Category:Chinese female speed skaters Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Jilin Category:Universiade silver medalists for China Category:Universiade medalists in short track speed skating Category:Competitors at the 1993 Winter Universiade
title: Zhang Jing (speed skater)
